column5: well year 2 of carp fishing for me and I have decided to take a different angle. Been throwing some fly's around at them and having a ball. Landed 4 so far on the fly biggest landed is 31 x 24 ( about 24 pounds) , last night I did battle with a monster that I fought for 40 minutes. It took me to the end of my backing twice and just would not come in the net. caught this one the night before and finally got a pic. Fish have been in shallow and have been eating everything. this one was a 17 pounder. My 6 pound leader held up in the weeds, around shopping carts and other cover  got 11 other one bait the last few weeks got to love the mighty carp... may need an intervention
Carp on a fly...that's pretty cool. How's that rod taste?
You done good CH!!! Betcha had to wear them fish down plum to a frazzle to get them in. Keep fiddlin' around like that and you might even get a line class record!!!
had it last night GCD! could not fit it in the net!

Ah h h  h   h . . . .    the feel of a big fish with plenty of power, on the receiving end of your line!! I certainly takes a lotta skill to keep a big one on light gear like that for 40 minutes, even if ya can't land 'im!! I've had 'em hit & take off on 'free spool' for at least 50' BEFORE I even got the rod off the pod, then peel 200+' of line out before I could get 'em stopped, with the massive carp rod & reel I use! The pulling power these guys have is awesome! I wonder just how many 'carp converts' there are on this board now . . . . .   a lot more than about 4 years ago I'll bet! Long live the 'lowly' carp!! Just headed for beautiful Hammie Harbour this mornin,' to try to get rid of the skunk smell!
NICE!!! Got to love it  Jackel
WTG crazyhook. They seem like alot of fun on a flyrod if you have the endurance to keep up the battle.  Nice big carp. I'm still searching for the big boys.    dsn

Carping on the fly is a total blast!  Nice fish too  There's no escape from carp.  Once bitten by the bug, symptoms may include 1) Desire to smell and taste groundbait flavours 2) Corn is at THE TOP of your grocery list 3) You drool profusely when you hear words that incorporate 'carp' in them: Like carpet or Carpel Tunnel syndrome  It's a disease with absolutely no cure.
Crayhook,  less then a week til Musky opens,  then you can forget about 'dem carp  lol

Nice Carp!   Thanks for sharing.     To bad you didnt have the "OFNCommunity.com" sign with you.  You could have added a few inches to Team 1's total.  Oh well....you will just have to go out and  get a 30" plus monster and don't forget that sign next time.  FOTB
Wow..that's sweet!  And on the fly too.  Awesome work...gotta be great landing them on that light line.
That's awesome Jamie, what a brute that carp is  Joey

Nice job ch , got to love them carp.Haven't been out yet myself (been to busy with those peskey BoQ walleye).Hope to get out in the near future.That has to be a blast on a fly rod.Keep up the reports.   Wes
Lol, thats awesome.  Where were you, Sunnyvale? =)))

Count me as a convert!  I've still got a ways to go to get all the proper gear, but I do have a pair of nice Baitrunner 4500's as a start.  Now the hard part, finding a quality 2.75lb test curve rod x 2 and a decent double buzzbar rod pod...  Tony
